p: Probes, which are short DNA sequences that are similar to parts of the sequence of target, are the most important constituent of a microarray chip. Probe has to be specific to a pathogen only, and then only it can identify a pathogen unambiguously. Besides specificity probe designing requires consideration of many other factors, which influence hybridization processes such as guanine/cytosine (G/C) content, melting point, secondary structure, sequence specificity, polynucleotide tract, and probe length. Probe length affects the sensitivity and specificity of hybridization, while other factors contribute to nonspecific hybridization.
